intro: Psychotria alpina, commonly known as the Alpine Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often in cloud forests, where it receives moderate sunlight and cool temperatures. Psychotria alpina is also known for its ecological importance, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators in its native habitat.
